Jargon Term: transfused 4 units of red blood cells
had the bleeding artery embolized by our interventional radiologists
no signs of further bleeding for 2 days afterwards
You were seen by our vascular surgeons who removed the line
our vascular surgeons who removed the line and felt comfortable that it had healed properly
Over the next few days you should avoid any heavy lifting or long distance walking to ensure the leg heals properly.

Jargon Term: If you develop any bleeding in your leg, your neck or in your stool please call your doctor immediately.

Jargon Term: During your bleeding a large IV was need to be placed in your leg in order to transfuse you blood as quickly as possible and keep your blood pressure up.
